For both bivariate regressions (i.e., reconstructing temperature in CGI with PUY and GVE, as well as data from EVI and SIO for LEY), the two input variables were highly correlated ( ρ(PUY, GVE) and ρ(EVI, SIO)). Therefore, one of each pair of variables was partialled out and the resulting residuals (i.e., r.PUY and r.EVI) were used instead, Eqs. 5 and 6, respectively. This was done again by applying two linear regressions followed by the calculation of the residual for each observation, Eq. 7 (PUY) and Eq. 8 (EVI), respectively.
